Requirement: The system must provide a singular Math Umbrella component accessible over the World Wide Web.
Reasoning: High value foundational component with moderate cost and risk; enables access to all learning modules.

Requirement: The introductory movie component must terminate playback and forward the user to the Main Menu if a mouse click is received.
Reasoning: Low cost and risk
column8: adds user control over the intro

Requirement: The introductory movie component must continue to completion and then move the user to the Main Menu if no mouse click is received.
Reasoning: Complementary to FR-004

Requirement: The system must display a Main Menu component.
Reasoning: Low cost and risk

Requirement: The Main Menu component must wait until the user selects a button.
Reasoning: Dependent on FR-006

Requirement: The Main Menu component must forward the user to the game sequence component or the Denominators' web page depending on the selected button.
Reasoning: Directs user flow; moderate cost and risk.

Requirement: The Game Sequence component must display a question and wait until the user chooses an answer option via mouse click.
Reasoning: Low cost/risk

Requirement: The Game Sequence component must display a success message and move to the next question if the user selects the correct answer.
Reasoning: Essential feedback loop; low cost and risk.

Requirement: The Game Sequence component must inform the user of the incorrect answer and give them another chance to answer the question.
Reasoning: Enhances learning and user experience; moderate-high value despite higher cost.

Requirement: The system must present a series of multiple-choice fraction questions that sequentially form a storyline.
Reasoning: High value core feature
column8: drives educational outcomes; implement after lower-risk game mechanics.

Requirement: The Game Sequence component must choose different plot directions at critical points based on whether the question was answered correctly.
Reasoning: High educational impact and engagement; complex but strategically important after core Q&A flow.

Requirement: The system must direct the user to the Ending Scene component after proceeding through a set number of questions.
Reasoning: Critical for completing game sequence; moderate cost and risk.

Requirement: The Ending Scene component must display the user's overall score.
Reasoning: Provides feedback and closure; low-moderate cost and risk.

Requirement: The Ending Scene component must display a conclusion to the game's plot based on performance at certain critical points.
Reasoning: High engagement and personalization; implement after scoring is functional.

Requirement: The Ending Scene component must offer the user the choice via mouse clicks to exit the game or return to the Main Menu.
Reasoning: Low cost/risk; enables user navigation post-game.

Requirement: The system must provide a web-accessible Question Updater tool for a game administrator.
Reasoning: High strategic value for maintainability and content updates; high risk/cost so later in roadmap.

Requirement: The Question Updater must utilize a web forms interface for input via pulldown menus and text fields.
Reasoning: Dependent on FR-018

Requirement: The Question Updater must check that the inputted question data is complete and makes sense in the context of the updated question after submission.
Reasoning: Validation critical for data integrity; implement after base updater interface.

Requirement: The Question Updater must generate a text file on the game server.
Reasoning: Enables game to dynamically load updated questions; dependent on FR-018 and FR-019.

Requirement: The Math Umbrella component must open the specified S2S product in a separate window.
Reasoning: Non-critical integration feature; moderate cost and high risk

Requirement: The user's score must be kept as local data within the game.
Reasoning: Simple
column8: low-risk foundational feature; can be implemented early but after core gameplay setup.
